intro: Palicourea herrerae, commonly known as Herrera's palicourea, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers and dense, evergreen foliage. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
